metadata.title: CVE-2019-14855 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the way certificate signatures could be forged usingcollisions found in the SHA-1 algorithm. An attacker could use thisweakness to create forged certificate signatures. This issue affects GnuPGversions before 2.2.18.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14855` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dirmngr - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gnupg - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gnupg-agent - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gnupg-l10n - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gnupg-utils - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gnupg2 - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gpg - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gpg-agent - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gpg-wks-client - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gpg-wks-server - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gpgconf - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gpgsm - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gpgv - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gpgv-static - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gpgv-win32 - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
gpgv2 - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
scdaemon - 2.2.19-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnupg2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.19-3ubuntu2').
gnupg1 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
